intro: Urostigma rubescens, commonly known as the red-stemmed dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its hairy, reddish stems and yellow composite flowers. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed areas and thrives in sandy or gravelly soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine, white hairs, while its flowers develop into fluffy, seed-bearing heads. Urostigma rubescens is often found in coastal regions and is adapted to withstand coastal conditions such as salt spray and strong winds.
